result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary J Burdine Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court WAIVED costs, fees, and surcharges due to lack of defendant's income.
Provide a DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution set at ZERO.
If revoked on COUNT 1, surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16 years.

Obtain mental health evaluation and comply with recommended treatment.
Comply with all the rules as set forth by agent.
Continue taking all medications as prescribed.
Defendant must register and comply with the sex offender registry for a period of 5 years. It is the Courts intentions the registration begin upon the completion.
Department of Corrections to verify the defendant's residence at 3011 N. Holton Ave.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Obtain sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment or counseling.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To Count 1; credit for 271 day time served. NO GOOD TIME.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Michael Thurston on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for probation review hearing. Defendant is in custody at MSDF and is being revoked from the probation ordered in this case. Court took no further action.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for probation review hearing. Defense counsel does not have any explanation for defendant's non-appearance. MSDF records reflect the defendant is currently in custody at MSDF. Parties do not have a report from the probation agent. Defense counsel requests adjournment to contact the defendant and speak to the probation agent. Court ordered a bench warrant be issued but STAYED pending the defendant's appearance at the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction signed and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
File sent to Branch 25 for correction.
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Order signed and filed. The Court hereby ORDERS the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department, to release this defendant from custody upon the satisfaction of his sentence during daylight hours only. tk
State notified of next court date, but is unavailable for the next scheduled date. Defense counsel notified. Case adjourned to 04-20-2015 at 08:30 am for probation review hearing in Branch 25.

Defendant Gary J Burdine in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Gary J Burdine in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy court clerk ccp/tk.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing. Probation agent Sara Watson also present in court. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Parties are prepared to proceed. Court finds that the State has complied with victim rights legislation. State placed negotiations on the record. 

As to COUNT 1- 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3  YEARS 6 MONTHS, consecutive to COUNT 2, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
As to COUNT 2-
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the Milwaukee County Jail consecutive to COUNT 1; credit for 271 days time served. NO GOOD TIME. 
Court STAYED the sentence on COUNT 1 and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions: 
1) Obtain sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment or counseling;
2) Court WAIVED costs, fees, and surcharges due to lack of defendants income;
3) Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment;
4) No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16 years. 
5) Defendant is prohibited from being present at any library;
6) Obtain mental health evaluation and comply with recommended treatment;
7) Comply with all rules as set forth by agent;
8) Continue taking all medications as prescribed;
9) Defendant must register and comply with the sex offender registry for a period of 5 years. It is the Courts intention the registration begin upon the completion of probation. 
10) Restitution set at ZERO
11) Department of Corrections to verify the defendants residence at 3011 N. Holton Ave. 

If revoked on COUNT 1 surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.
If revoked Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is not appropriate for the Substance Abuse Program.

Filed, 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Court back on the record. Defense Counsel and defendant still in Court. ADA Erin Karshen not in court. After the hearing was completed defendant became disruptive in court. Court ordered a Probation hearing be set. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Gary J Burdine not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties do not object to an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

This matter is currently scheduled for 8:30 a.m. on December 18th, 2014. Due to scheduling and the defendant being high risk, this case is rescheduled to 10:00 a.m. on the same date. Parties notified and do not object. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Gary J Burdine not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is continuing to work on finding a placement agency for the defendant. State does not object to an adjournment. Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Gary J Burdine in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Gary J Burdine in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed offer on the record.Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

As to COUNT 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Discussion regarding proceeding to sentencing today and defendant's pretrial incarceration credit. Court ordered this matter adjourned to allow defense counsel to develop a plan for community supervision. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Gary J Burdine not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Due to calendar congestion, Court is unable to hear this matter today. Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Gary J Burdine not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are still in negotiations and request an adjourned plea hearing date. Defense informs the court there is a possibility of a global resolution with defendant's other pending case 14CF2446. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary J Burdine in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Gary J Burdine in custody.  Mark Williams on behalf of Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on doctor's report. Report written by Dr. Collins previously filed on 6/06/14. Dr. Collins' report does not support an NGI plea. Defense counsel formally withdraws request to proceed with NGI plea. Court accepts the findings in the report and finds an NGI plea is not supported. Defense requests projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Invoice dated: 06-30-2014
Invoice forwarded to A/P on 07-09-2014 in the amount of $562.50 to Dr. Collins for services on 5/27, 5/28, 6/6/2014. 
COPY IN FILE. sdg

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Gary J Burdine not in court, in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. Defendant is high risk and due to inadequate number of personnel in the Sheriff's Department today, the defendant was unable to be brought up in a timely fashion. Court will defer ruling on the NGI evaluation report until the competency evaluation is completed in defendant's other pending case 14CF2446. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Gary J Burdine not in court, in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on doctor's report. Branch 25 in trial and unable to hear this matter. Both parties have received the doctor's report. Defense waives defendant's appearance for this hearing. State will be filing additional charges. Parties request status date after new charges have been filed. Court will address doctor's reprot at the next court date. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's report received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Gary J Burdine in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Gary J Burdine in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant enters a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.15(91).  The Court orders (and by stipulation of the parties) that a doctor from the Wisconsin Forensic Unit be appointed to examine the defendant pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.16(2).  Order Appointing Doctor signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary J Burdine in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Gary J Burdine in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION, Absolutely No Release from Home (24 Hour Curfew) GPS Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers, no alcohol.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.A.T. (DOB 9/3/60), T.L.N. (DOB 1/13/00), T.L.N. (DOB 1/13/00), Villard Ave. Library. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gary J Burdine in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Gary J Burdine in custody.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
